Name: The Magic of Protection Stones
Content:
The Magic of Protection Stones

A little magic goes a long way, especially when it comes to protection. Natural stones and crystals have been used for centuries to provide defense against negative energy and vibes. In this modern world, we often forget the power of nature and the importance of staying connected to the earth. But when you're looking for some extra armor in your everyday life, turn to protection stones. Here are six of the best that can help you stay safe and protected: 

Protection stones include:

1) Amethyst: 

Amethyst is a popular choice for protection stones. It is said to create a bubble of spiritual protection around the wearer, as well as shielding them from negative energy. Amethyst is also thought to be helpful in warding off depression and addiction. This purple crystal is hand-selected for each bracelet. Each bracelet is made with love in Corvallis, Oregon.

Anything is magic if you have the intention. Click Here to shop our store

2) Tigers Eye: 

Tigers Eye is a type of protection stone that has been used throughout history for its ability to offer both physical and psychic protection. Tigers Eye is said to be particularly helpful in deflecting negative energy and illness. Tigers Eye is also believed to promote courage, strength, and confidence. In the crystal healing tradition, Tigers Eye is often used to balance the chakras and provide grounding and stability. Tigers Eye can be worn as jewelry or carried as a talisman.

3) Smokey Quartz: 

Smokey Quartz is a popular choice for jewelry and other decorative items because of its beauty and its purported healing properties. In crystal healing, Smokey Quartz is said to be helpful for grounding and protection. It is also said to promote concentration and focus, making it a good choice for students or anyone who needs a little extra help staying on task. 

Anything is magic if you have the intention. Click Here to shop our store

4) Obsidian: 

Obsidian is a popular choice for crystal healing and protection stones. It is a type of volcanic glass with a rich history dating back to ancient times. Obsidian was used by many cultures for making tools, weapons, and jewelry. It is still used today for a variety of purposes, including making bracelets, pendants, and other handcrafted jewelry. Obsidian is said to have powerful protective qualities. It is thought to deflect negativity and help to shield the wearer from harm. Obsidian is also believed to promote inner strength and courage. For these reasons, it is an excellent stone to use for protection and healing.

5) Labradorite: 

Labradorite is a beautiful, iridescent stone that has been used for centuries for its protective properties. It is said to deflect negative energy and to boost the wearer's own energy field. Labradorite is also believed to connect the wearer to their higher self, and to promote spiritual growth. Labradorite bracelets are traditionally hand-made, and each bracelet is unique. The stones are carefully selected for their size, shape, and color. The bracelet is then strung on a durable cord and finished with a secure clasp. Labradorite bracelets make thoughtful gifts for friends and loved ones, and can be worn as a reminder to stay positive and connected to your highest self.

Conclusion: 

If you are looking for a little extra protection in your life, consider adding one of these stones to your jewelry collection. You can find our beautiful and unique protection stones in the form of a hand-made bracelet or necklace at our online store. With so many different crystals and gemstones to choose from, we are sure you will find the perfect piece to help keep you safe and protected.

1. What is Tigers Eye crystal and where does it come from?

Tigers Eye is a type of crystal that is known for its distinctive yellow and brown stripes. It is found in a number of locations around the world, including South Africa, Australia, and the United States. Tigers Eye is usually found in sedimentary rock formations, and the crystals are formed through a process of metamorphism. During this process, the original rock is heated and compressed, causing the minerals to recrystallize. This gives Tigers Eye its unique striped appearance. The name Tigers Eye comes from the belief that the patterns on the crystal resemble those of a tiger's eye.
